Literature Review: The increasing globalization of the ornamental plant industry has led to a significant rise in the international trade of ornamental plants, which in turn has resulted in the global movement of pathogens to countries where they were not formerly known. This has led to the emergence of new diseases and the spread of existing ones, causing significant economic losses to the industry. This literature review aims to discuss the current state of knowledge on the international trade and local effects of viral and bacterial diseases in ornamental plants, with a focus on the impact on production and regulation.
